overview.name: Programme overview
overview.paragraph: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a devastating economic impact, threatening the jobs and livelihoods of many South Africans – especially the most vulnerable. The pandemic has exacerbated South Africa’s pre-existing crises of poverty and unemployment.The Presidential Employment Stimulus seeks to confront this impact directly, as part of government’s broader economic recovery agenda. Its aim is to use direct public investment to support employment opportunities – starting right now.

departments.name: Trade, Industry and Competition
departments.lead: Piloting new models for re-shoring and expanding global business services
departments.paragraph: The Global Business Services Sector has an impressive track record. Established in 2006/7 to provide offshore customer service delivery, the sector has built from a low base to achieve an average year-on-year export revenue growth of at least 20% since 2014.

implementation_detail.detail: The Global Business Services incentive programme has been re-instated. The programme is progressing well and may exceed its target.

departments.name: Basic Education
departments.lead: Teachers assistants and other support for schools
departments.paragraph: A key priority identified in the National Development Plan is the improvement of quality education, skills development, and innovation. One intervention that has seen some experimentation in South Africa, with significant potential to scale nationally, is the use of school assistants to strengthen the learning environment. An important rationale for school assistants is the need to support teachers in the classroom, freeing up time for teaching and providing additional support to learners to improve education outcomes.

implementation_detail.detail: Appointments have been finalised in most of the provinces and 94% of the assistants have been placed.
Appointments have been finalised in most of the provinces and 94% of the assistants have been placed.
The programme was undersubscribed and the department is exploring alternative use for unspent funds

departments.name: Social Development
departments.lead: Income support to practitioners and to the implementation of Covid compliance measures
departments.paragraph: Livelihoods from the provision of Early Childhood Development services were severely disrupted by the pandemic, with providers facing challenges with re-opening. There are costs associated with doing so safely, and some parents can no longer afford to pay fees as a result of job losses.

implementation_detail.detail: The programme faced significant delays and challenges in the planning phase and will not be implemented

dimensions.name: Jobs saved going to 18-35 year olds

implementation_detail.detail: Appointments and re-appointments have been finalised in several participating programmes and social workers have commenced work.

The department is working closely with its partners in the ECD sector to distribute income support for 108,833 workers in registered and unregistered ECD programmes. Verification is currently underway.

departments.name: Health
departments.lead: Primary Health Care is at the frontline of the battle against Covid-19
departments.paragraph: As the world responds to the COVID-19 pandemic, the critical role that community health workers play to enhance the resilience of the national health care system has been foregrounded. They have been on the frontline of active case-finding through screening and contact tracing.

implementation_detail.detail: Appointment commenced immediately and the department has exceeded its target
Appointments commenced immediately and is progressing well.
The department faced severe constraints related to recruitment and the programme will not be implemented.
The department faced severe constraints related to recruitment and the programme will not be implemented.

departments.name: Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Development
departments.lead: Expanding support to farmers and protecting food value chains
departments.paragraph: The pandemic has illustrated the vulnerability of our food production and distribution systems. Although exempt from the strictest lockdown regulations, the sector faced severe challenges with disruptions to production and marketing experienced by many small-scale farmers.

implementation_details.detail: Over 178 000 applications were received through the USSD platform established by the department, and the process of issuing vouchers to eligible applicants has begun.

departments.name: Science and Innovation
departments.lead: Supporting new graduates entering a hostile labour market
departments.paragraph: Given a constrained labour market, fewer opportunities will be available to graduates leaving institutions of higher learning in 2021.\n\nThe Department of Science and Innovation will deliver four programmes through its entities designed to minimise this impact, which will together offer 1,900 unemployed graduates an opportunity to earn an income while gaining meaningful work experience.

implementation_detail.detail: There were delays in the planning phase however, recruitment is underway and is being conducted in two phases.
The transfer of funds was delayed resulting in a slow start.
Placement has commenced however was affected by university system closures which meant students could not register and provide proof as part of application process.
There were delays in the planning phase however, recruitment is underway.

departments.name: Sports, Arts and Culture
departments.lead: To get artists, cultural workers and the sporting sector on the road to recovery
departments.paragraph: Under lockdown, there has been no loud applause in jazz venues, no curtain calls for the dancers, no tourists in craft markets – and no victory laps for our sports people. No segment of the creative, cultural and sporting sectors have been untouched

implementation_detail.detail: Appointed participants have commenced work however the demand from organisations has been low.

departments.name: Transport
departments.lead: Improving access to services and opportunities for people in rural areas
departments.paragraph: Rural roads play a vital role in connecting rural communities to services such as health and education, as well as providing access to markets and economic opportunities. However, rural roads infrastructure remains poor in many areas of South Africa

implementation_detail.detail: Several provinces have commenced with projects and recruited participants. Some provinces are facing challenges with procurement and project implementation was affected by cyclone Eloise.

departments.name: Public Works and Infrastructure
departments.lead: Graduate placements in the professional services
departments.paragraph: In addition to structural skills shortages that were experienced prior to the pandemic, the management of facilities and completion of infrastructure projects has been further impacted by restrictions on the movement of people and limitations placed on completing infrastructure projects during the lockdown. As the economy re-opens, additional capacity is required to address the backlog so that service provision can be restored

departments.name: Environment, Forestry and Fisheries
departments.lead: Investing in the environment we live in
departments.paragraph: The work undertaken in environmental, forestry and fishery programmes will touch the length and breadth of the country, from coast to coast, including bushveld, grassland, fynbos, wetlands, mountains, water bodies, catchment areas  – and urban areas, too. The work undertaken affects the air we breathe, the water we drink, the energy we use and the food we eat, supporting a wealth of biodiversity resources and ecological systems essential to life on earth and to the future of the planet.

departments.name: Co-operative government
departments.lead: Mainstreaming and improving labour-intensity in infrastructure delivery
departments.paragraph: Prioritising infrastructure maintenance Mainstreaming and improving labour-intensity in infrastructure deliveryCommunity access to water and sanitation is all the more important in the context of the crisisTOTAL BUDGETR50MJOB OPPORTUNITIES25,000 Before the crisis, many municipalities were already facing critical funding shortfalls and challenges in the sustainable delivery of basic services and the maintenance of infrastructure. The pandemic has compounded these problems by cancelling or stalling implementation of all non-critical infrastructure projects

implementation_detail.detail: MISA is appointing a service provider to deliver the capacity development and roll-out the programme.
